Big blue bus 
 Mecelin Kakoro 
 English 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 There was only 
 
 one bus in 
 
 Ebei’s vilage. 
 
 
 
 It was big and blue. 
 
 It was very noisy. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 One day, Ebei’s 
 
 mother said, 
 
 “Tomorow we wil 
 
 go to town to buy 
 
 your schol uniform.” 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 2  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei was very excited. 
 
 
 
 They would travel 
 
 in the big blue 
 
 bus. 
 
 
 
 He could not slep 
 
 that night. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 3  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei was already 
 
 dresed when his 
 
 mother came to 
 
 wake him. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei and his mother walked 
 
 to the 
 
 bus stop. 
 
 
 
 They waited for 
 
 the big blue bus. 
 
 
 
 But the bus 
 
 
 did not come. 
 
 
 
 
 
 5  
 
 
 
 
 
 Other people arived 
 
 at the bus stop. 
 
 
 
 They complained 
 
 because the bus 
 
 was late. 
 
 
 
 “Has the bus 
 
 left us?” 
 
 
 they asked. 
 
 
 
 
 6  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei was woried. 
 
 
 
 "We wil not be able 
 
 to go to town. 
 
 I wil not be able 
 
 to get my uniform," 
 
 he thought. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 7  
 
 
 
 
 
 Some people gave up 
 
 and went home. 
 
 
 
 But Ebei cried and 
 
 did not want to go. 
 
 
 
 His mother 
 
 comforted him. 
 
 “We wil wait 
 
 
 a bit longer,” she said. 
 
 
 
 
 8  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Sudenly, they heard 
 
 a noise. 
 
 
 
 They saw dust 
 
 in the air. 
 
 
 
 The bus was coming! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 9  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 But this bus was not 
 
 blue. It was not big. 
 
 
 
 This bus was red 
 
 and smal. 
 
 
 
 The waiting people 
 
 loked at this bus. 
 
 
 They did not get in. 
 
 
 
 
 
 10  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 “Get in! Get in!” shouted the 
 
 driver. 
 
 
 
 “We are very late today,” he 
 
 said. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 1  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei and his mother 
 
 got in first. 
 
 
 
 Son everyone else 
 
 got in the smal 
 
 red bus. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 12  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei loked out the 
 
 window. He saw 
 
 more people at 
 
 the bus stop. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 13  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Even more people 
 
 were runing to 
 
 catch the bus. 
 
 
 
 But they were to late. 
 
 The bus was ful. 
 
 
 
 The red bus left 
 
 
 for town. 
 
 
 
 
 
 14  
 
 
 
 
 
 “Where is the big 
 
 blue bus?” asked 
 
 Ebei’s mother. 
 
 
 
 “It broke down,” 
 
 replied the driver. 
 
 
 
 “We are fixing it. 
 
 It wil come tomorow,” 
 
 
 he aded. 
 
 
 
 
 15  
 
 
 
 
 
 Ebei did not care 
 
 about the colour of 
 
 the bus. 
 
 He did not care 
 
 about the size of 
 
 the bus. 
 
 
 
 He was hapy 
 
 because this bus 
 
 
 was going to town. 
 
 
 
 
 16
